intro: Coccoloba microphylla, commonly known as the rocknettle, is a flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America, typically growing in coastal areas and rocky soils. The plant features small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hairs, giving it a silvery appearance. Its flowers are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences and are usually greenish-white in color. Coccoloba microphylla is adapted to saline environments and is often found in tidal zones and dunes.
